data.description: Want to accelerate your career? Join a team of driven people, performing with purpose.  At Avis Budget Group, we are proud to be a performance driven organization. Our 21,000+ employees encourage each other to be at their best through outstanding leadership, training and tools and rewards.  As a participant of our ABG Accelerate internship program you will be encouraged to explore different areas of our business to grow both personally and professionally to jump start a rewarding career. *This role is for DEC 2025 & MAY/JUNE 2026 graduates only*As a Deployed Transformation Engineer, you will build and deliver technology solutions that improve how Avis Budget Group operates. As part of the Transformation organization, you will help shape the next generation of applications that enable smarter decisions, better efficiency, and stronger business outcomes. The solutions you build will be used by thousands of people across our global operations, powering daily work and decisions at every level of the company. In this role, you’ll guide both the technical direction and the collaboration between our engineering and business teams. You’ll work closely with stakeholders across the company to identify challenges, prototype and refine solutions, and help scale them into production-ready systems. Why This Role This is not a traditional engineering role. It’s a chance to shape how a global business operates. You’ll be on the front lines of innovation, working side by side with operators, analysts, and executives to turn ideas into scalable systems that power the next era of Avis Budget Group. What You'll Do:Build solutions that are intuitive, reliable, and truly adopted by end users – ensuring the tools you create deliver real value in day-to-day operations. Collaborate with business and operations teams to understand workflows, identify opportunities for improvement, and define technical requirements. Develop and iterate on technical solutions for complex business challenges, from concept through deployment. Quickly understand and enhance existing applications and production workflows, including those that support critical business operations. Support solution rollouts and adoption through documentation, user support, and training What we're looking for:Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Operations Research, Physics Proficiency in Python, Java, or TypeScript/JavaScript and familiarity with modern frameworks and development tools Ability to collaborate effectively with non-technical stakeholders to translate needs into technical solutions. Excellent communication skills; able to bridge technical and non-technical discussions effectively Comfortable working in ambiguous, fast-paced environments and prioritizing for maximum business impact Willingness to travel 10–25% to collaborate with field teams and support deployments Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with RESTful APIs and web application development. Understanding of modern web design principles and responsive interfaces. Prior experience working in transformation, analytics, or operations technology projects.The annual starting salary for this position is between $60,000 – $85,000.Factors that may affect starting pay within this range include geography/market, skills, education, work experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.Who we are:Here at Avis Budget Group, you will be joining a team of 25,000 driven people, performing with purpose. Together, we’re moving the future of transportation forward with our innovative, customer-focused solutions.Our culture is performance driven, where we encourage and support each other to be at our best through leadership, training, tools, and rewards.We are proud to make a positive difference to the lives of our colleagues, customers, and communities where we operate.Avis Budget Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other category protected by applicable law.This advertisement does not constitute a promise or guarantee of employment. This advertisement describes the general nature and level of this position only. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require. The compensation and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law. This position may be with any affiliate of Avis Budget Group. ParsippanyNew JerseyUnited States of America
requirements: Collaborate with business and operations teams to understand workflows, identify opportunities for improvement, and define technical requirements.
Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Operations Research, Physics
responsibilities: Develop and iterate on technical solutions for complex business challenges, from concept through deployment.
Proficiency in Python, Java, or TypeScript/JavaScript and familiarity with modern frameworks and development tools
Ability to collaborate effectively with non-technical stakeholders to translate needs into technical solutions.
Willingness to travel 10–25% to collaborate with field teams and support deployments
Familiarity with RESTful APIs and web application development.
